meanings.definition: To give (money or help) in order to achieve or provide something together with other people.
meanings.sent1: She contributed some money to the charity event.
meanings.sent2: The team members contributed equally to the project's success.
meanings.sent3: His contribution to the bake sale helped raise funds for the school.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude contributed to the overall morale of the group.
meanings.sent5: Their combined efforts contributed to a beautiful community garden.

meanings.definition: To help to make something happen.
meanings.sent1: The sunny weather contributed to the success of the outdoor event.
meanings.sent2: His hard work contributed significantly to the completion of the project.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain contributed to the cancellation of the picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity contributed a fresh perspective to the team's brainstorming session.
meanings.sent5: The supportive community contributed to her quick recovery from illness.

meanings.definition: To write or provide something for a publication.
meanings.sent1: She contributed an article to the school newspaper.
meanings.sent2: The author contributed a chapter to the book on wildlife conservation.
meanings.sent3: His humor column contributed a light-hearted touch to the magazine.
meanings.sent4: Their research findings contributed valuable insights to the scientific journal.
meanings.sent5: The photographer's images contributed to the visual appeal of the travel magazine.
